Config Manager API<br /><br />NT Native API Tue, 23 Aug 2005 16:40:55 PDT http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=67 JEDI VCS Client 2.40 RC2 available http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=66 On behalf of the JEDI VCS team I'm pleased to announce<br />JVCS Client 2.40 RC2 which is available for download at:<br /><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/jedivcs" target="_blank">http://sourceforge.net/projects/jedivcs</a><br /><br />Most important new feature is the basic IDE integration support for<br />Delphi8/2005 & C#Builder1<br />Now we've splitted IDE integration:<br />a) Delphi5/6 & C++Builder5/6 is supported over VCSManager<br />b) Delphi7/8/2005 & C#Builder1 is supported as Wizard/Expert<br />Upgrade for Delphi7 from JVCS 2.40 RC1 is integrated in the<br />setup process.<br /><br />Console client has a new feature which allows sync over<br />labeled sources so you can rollback your local sources based<br />on a label in your repository.<br /><br />All changes in this release are included in the Release documentation<br />which is also available for seperate download in the SF files section.<br /><br />For reporting problems please use the JVCS Bug/Wish list on<br /><a href="http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/issuetracker" target="_blank">http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/issuetracker</a> Sat, 30 Apr 2005 05:12:28 PDT http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=66 JEDI JCL Release 1.95.3 available http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=65 JCL release 1.95 includes major additions; thanks to the generous<br />donation of the Delphi Container Library (DCL) v. 0.89 code base by its<br />creator Jean-Philippe Bempel, the JCL now provides a set of carefully<br />designed container classes and interfaces, supplied by the newly added<br />units:<br /><br />source\common\JclAbstractContainers.pas<br />source\common\JclAlgorithms.pas<br />source\common\JclArrayLists.pas<br />source\common\JclArraySets.pas<br />source\common\JclBinaryTrees.pas<br />source\common\JclContainerIntf.pas<br />source\common\JclHashMaps.pas<br />source\common\JclHashSets.pas<br />source\common\JclLinkedLists.pas<br />source\common\JclQueues.pas<br />source\common\JclStacks.pas<br />source\common\JclVectors.pas<br /><br />Note that documentation is still in early stage and might even be<br />incorrect, so beware.<br />The installer option "Thread safe container classes allows to trade off<br />between speed (off) and safeness (on). If it's on, synchronization in<br />multithreaded applications is handled internally, otherwise it is left<br />to the developer.<br /><br />Although this one stands out, there have been other valuable additions<br />like unit JclWideFormat by Rob Kennedy, the JEDI Uses Wizard and more.<br />CPU information code in JclSysInfo has been updated to report features<br />of recent CPU types.<br /><br />For Delphi 2005, integrated Online Help and installer access to the<br />Object Repository are still not available.<br /><br />As always, multiple bugs have been fixed; for detailed change logs, use<br />the facilities of our CVS repository at SourceForge.net<br /><<a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/jcl/" target="_blank">http://sourceforge.net/projects/jcl/</a>>, see below.<br /><br />Supported Tools<br /><br />* Delphi version 5, 6, 7, 2005/Win32<br />* C++Builder version 5 & 6<br />* Kylix 3 Mon, 28 Mar 2005 08:03:25 PST http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=65 JVCL 3.00 available http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=64 The JVCL Team is proud to announce that the stable release of JVCL 3.00 is available for download.<br /><br />JVCL is a library of more than 570 visual and non-visual components for Delphi 5, 6, 7 and 2005; C++Builder 5, 6 and Kylix 3. JVCL is <br />distributed subject to the Mozilla Public License Version 1.1 (<a href="http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/MPL-1.1.html" target="_blank">http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/MPL-1.1.html</a>) and is completely free for all developers (open source, shareware or commercial) and includes the full source to all components.<br /><br />This release contains changes, additions and bugfixes too numerous to <br />list here, but here are some of the highlights:<br /><br />- Support for Delphi 5, 6, 7 and 2005 (Win32)<br />- Support for C++ Builder 5 and 6<br />- Support for Kylix 3<br />- The monolithic package structure of JVCL 2.10 has been broken into <br />smaller packages.<br />- Files have been renamed and arranged using a more logical naming <br />scheme and folder structure, making it easier to find what you are <br />looking for.<br />- Numerous components have been merged. This means there are almost no <br />duplicates in JVCL anymore.<br />- The full install contains a tool to convert large parts of your source <br />from JVCL 2.10 to JVCL 3.00, simplifying migration.<br />- Several new components and libraries have been added, among them UIB, <br />Globus, KWizard, DockPresident, Managed Threads, UIL Time Framework, <br />dxPack II, Jans Components, Print Preview, Ultim DB Components, Full <br />Color controls, a LED control, a checkbox/radiobutton treeview and an <br />XML database.<br />- A new package generator that creates packages for all supported <br />platforms from XML files.<br />- A new installer that knows about and automatically detects package <br />dependecies, installing what you need in each supported version.<br />- Improved support for Windows XP theming.<br />- Improved support for VisualCLX (not complete).<br />- Numerous bugs fixed.<br />- Support for localization using dxgettext <br />(<a href="http://dxgettext.sourceforge.net" target="_blank">http://dxgettext.sourceforge.net</a>)<br /><br />If you are currently using JVCL 2.10, please read the documentation <br />*carefully* before installing JVCL 3, especially the migration document.<br /><br />This release is available in four different flavors:<br />- Full install + latest JCL<br />- Full install without JCL<br />- Source and examples only<br />- Source only<br /><br />Later on we will also provide separate downloads for those packages that can be installed in a "stand-alone" mode (JvUIB, JvWizard, JvGlobus, JvManagedThreads, JvDocking, JvXPCtrls and JvDotNetCtrls)<br /><br />To download JVCL 3, go to <a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/jvcl" target="_blank">http://sourceforge.net/projects/jvcl</a> and click the "Files" link at the top or go directly at this address: <br /><a href="http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=45786" target="_blank">http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=45786</a><br /><br />The current version is JVCL 3.00.<br /><br />The JVCL Team<br /><a href="http://jvcl.sourceforge.net" target="_blank">http://jvcl.sourceforge.net</a> Mon, 28 Mar 2005 08:02:17 PST http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=64 JVCS appserver ports RC4 available Thu, 23 Dec 2004 17:16:00 PST http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=59 DCL (Delphi Container Library) joins JEDI JCL http://homepages.borland.com/jedi/cms/modules/news/article.php?storyid=60 The JCL Team is proud to announce that Jean-Philippe BEMPEL agreed to donate his Delphi Container Library (DCLX) to the Jedi Code Library.<br /><br />The Delphi Container Library is a free library that provides ArrayList, LinkedList, Vector, HashMap, HashSet, ArraySet, Queue and Stack (among others)<br /><br />More information on DCL: <a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/dclx" target="_blank">http://sourceforge.net/projects/dclx</a><br /><br />Many thanks Jean-Philippe!
